profile_data.summary:
As a Data Scientist at BrickSimple LLC, I applied my skills and knowledge in Python, Machine Learning, Data Visualization, and Image Analysis to create innovative and impactful data solutions for various clients and industries. With 4+ years of experience specializing in developing and deploying AI/ML solutions across healthcare, real estate, and business intelligence domains. Proven track record in leading and managing cross-functional teams and delivering high-impact projects using cutting-edge technologies including LLMs, Deep Learning and Computer Vision. Experienced in full ML lifecycle management and stakeholder collaboration.

My responsibilities at BrickSimple were:
- Managed end-to-end machine learning lifecycle, including data collection, preprocessing, model development, and deployment in production.
- Engaged with clients and senior stakeholders to align machine learning projects with strategic business objectives.
- Served as a team lead, managing a team of 2-3 people, providing guidance and project oversight to ensure successful delivery of AI solutions.
- Managed machine learning projects from conception to deployment, ensuring timely delivery, alignment with business goals, and adherence to quality standards.
- Acted as a subject matter expert in machine learning, staying updated with industry trends to deliver innovative solutions.
- Maintain up-to-date knowledge of industry trends and best practices in data science and machine learning.

With over four years of Data Science professional experience at BrickSimple LLC, I have successfully developed and deployed predictive and regression models using algorithms such as LSTMs, Random Forests, SVMs, Large Language Models, AWS ML models, Google Cloud Platform, Clustering Techniques, Deep Neural Networks, etc. I have also worked with various database technologies, such as SQL and Microsoft SQL Server, and data visualization and analysis tools, such as Tableau Desktop and Tableau Prep. I am passionate about solving complex data problems and delivering value to my clients and company.
In my previous roles, I have helped to increase the efficiency, speed, and cost reduction of IT processes and workflows by using automation and orchestration tools, such as Microsoft SCORCH and Python. 
Email- manishgrover9313@gmail.com
profile_data.headline: Looking for job opportunities in Data Science | Former Data Scientist @ BrickSimple LLC | Master of Science from University Of Illinois, Machine Learning

experience.description:
Responsibilities:
•Managed end-to-end machine learning lifecycle, including data collection, preprocessing, model development, and deployment in production.
•Engaged with clients and senior stakeholders to align machine learning projects with strategic business objectives.
•Served as a team lead, managing a team of 2-3 people, providing guidance and project oversight to ensure successful delivery of AI solutions.
•Managed machine learning projects from conception to deployment, ensuring timely delivery, alignment with business goals, and adherence to quality standards.
Projects:
•AI Chatbot: Developed a RAG-based chatbot using OpenAI API to automate responses for visitors' inquiries on BrickSimple's website. The solution enabled accurate and dynamic engagement with prospective clients by leveraging the company’s past work data, significantly enhancing user interaction and information accessibility. Regularly interacted with directors and key stakeholders to ensure project alignment with business objectives.
•Real Estate Document Analyzer: Managed and engineered an innovative OCR-driven system leveraging named entity recognition (NER) and BERT language models to precisely extract critical data from real estate documents. Achieved an accuracy rate of over 92%, resulting in a substantial reduction in human error and cost associated with manual data extraction processes.
•Sales Forecasting Model: Led the design and implementation of a Long Short-Term Memory deep learning model for sales forecasting across multiple SKUs. This initiative led to a notable improvement in inventory management efficiency and optimization, driving substantial cost savings and revenue growth.
•Surgery Equipment Detection: Developed a state-of-the-art object detection system utilizing Mask R-CNNs for medical environments. This innovative solution significantly enhanced safety protocols and operational efficiency in healthcare settings, ensuring optimal patient care delivery.
experience.title: Senior Data Scientist

education.schoolName: Maharaja Agrasen Institute Of Technology, Guru Gobind Singh Indraprastha University

publications.name: Determination of Inductive and Capacitive Components of Electrical Equivalent Circuit of Four-Terminal-Pair Capacitance Standards
publications.description: The reported work has been carried out at LF, HF impedance and DC standard laboratory, the sub-division of ALSIM (Apex level Standards and Industrial Metrology) of CSIR-NPL. The laboratory is responsible for establishing and maintaining impedance standards at low and high frequency, dc standards and dc high voltage standards. The four-terminal-pair (4TP) capacitance standards used in the present work are Agilent 16380A type of nominal values 100 and 1000 pF. These standards can be represented by electrical equivalent circuit model (EECM) as described by Suzuki. The objective of this work is to determine the capacitive and inductive components of EECM, so that frequency characteristics of the 4TP capacitance standards are known.

projects.description:
-> Achieved real time tracking and recognition of multiple objects when seen through the HoloLens.
-> Successfully able to classify different objects into their respective class when a person sees that object through the HoloLens.
-> Created a server-client connection between the computer (server) and the HoloLens (client).
-> HoloLens' webcam is used to take picture of the real world continuously and that picture is then fed to the computer where trained convolution neural network is running and it takes that picture as input and gives the output with the label of the image. 
-> Built an Artificial Convolutional Neural Network classifier that can recognize images using Keras and TensorFlow backend.
projects.title: Real-Time Multi-Object Tracking and Recognition using Microsoft HoloLens (Python, Keras, CNNs, OpenCV)

member.occupation: Looking for job opportunities in Data Science | Former Data Scientist @ BrickSimple LLC | Master of Science from University Of Illinois, Machine Learning

projects.description:
-> Built a chat-bot capable of conversing with a person using sequence-to-Sequence learning and LSTMs (RNNs).
-> Used Cornell Movie--Dialogs Corpus which contains a large metadata-rich collection of fictional conversations extracted from raw movie scripts. It has 220,579 conversational exchanges between 10,292 pairs of movie characters. Involves 9,035 characters from 617 movies, in total 304,713 utterances.
-> Data pre-processing was done with the help of various natural language processing techniques such as tokenization, lemmatization, stemming etc.
-> Used techniques like word embeddings, word2vec etc to convert the text data into numerical data.
-> The model was trained using two Long Short Term Memory networks (RNNs).
projects.title: Sequence-to-Sequence Chat-Bot using Recurrent Neural Networks (Python, NLTK, Keras, Scikit learn)

member.occupation: Looking for job opportunities in Data Science | Former Data Scientist @ BrickSimple LLC | Master of Science from University Of Illinois, Machine Learning

projects.description:
-> Used machine learning models such as deep CNN and feed forward neural network to classify images to their respective class. Models were tuned by changing various parameters like number of epochs, number of layers, number of neurons, type of activation function, batch size, learning rate etc to obtain highest accuracy.
-> Achieved an accuracy of 82 % by using deep CNN model.
-> The CIFAR-10 dataset was used which consists of 60000 32x32 colour images (RGB) in 10 classes, with 6000 images per class. There are 50000 training images and 10000 test images.
projects.title: Multi-class classification of images using CIFAR-10 dataset (Python, CNN, Scikit learn, Keras)
